episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the historical church intervals on the London Underground, the invention of the Good Humour ice cream bar, Kublai Khan's foldable summer palace, and the taste of billion-year-old water. The hosts delve into these facts with humor and curiosity, exploring historical anecdotes and scientific discoveries.

facts.fact: The London Underground used to have a church interval on Sundays.
The first ice cream on a stick was called the Good Humour Bar.
Kublai Khan's summer palace could be dismantled and folded away at the end of every summer.
According to the people who have drunk it, billion year old water tastes terrible.
